interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/06/13
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Gianna Smart', 'Martin Bruestle'], 'Starring': ['James Gandolfini', 'Edie Falco', 'Lorraine Bracco']}
Review Text: I was a fan of The Sopranos from the start. For personal reasons that are too complicated to explain I missed the second half of the last season. Now, as a Prime member, I had the opportunity to watch the whole season again. I am still a fan, and as controversial as  it was at the time, I like the finale. Whatever happened to Tony and his family is left to the imagination of the viewer and we can think of any future we want for him without being disappointed. It was also bittersweet to see James Gandolfini delivering a perfect Tony. It is sad to realize the we will never see him again. Rest in peace James and thank you for Tony.
Review Title: The show the redefined how we see mobsters
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Don't get me wrong, I like DA very much. Who would not like Maggie Smith's character, or the beautiful daughters or the British accent. But in in the end this is just another melodrama. Only a very fine one. Enjoy while it lasts.
Top Level Telenovela
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rob Bowman', 'John Terlesky', 'Bill Roe', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Paul Holahan', 'Thomas J. Wright', 'Jeff Bleckner', 'David Barrett', 'Kate Woods', 'Larry Shaw']}
I am literally hooked on Castle. I watch reruns all the time. It's probably not the best TV series ever made but it's highly entertaining, witty and it also has it's serious moments, when meaningful things are said. Plus it has Stana Katic, whom I think is one of the most beautiful women on TV right now.
Hooked on Castle

I was a fan of The Sopranos from the start. For personal reasons that are too complicated to explain I missed the second half of the last season. Now, as a Prime member, I had the opportunity to watch the whole season again. I am still a fan, and as controversial as  it was at the time, I like the finale. Whatever happened to Tony and his family is left to the imagination of the viewer and we can think of any future we want for him without being disappointed. It was also bittersweet to see James Gandolfini delivering a perfect Tony. It is sad to realize the we will never see him again. Rest in peace James and thank you for Tony.

profile:
The user continues to exhibit a strong preference for high-quality television dramas that prioritize character development, humor, and emotional depth. Their recent interaction reflects a deep appreciation for classic narratives that redefine genres, emphasizing engaging storytelling that combines comedic elements with suspense and complex relationships. The user's analytical viewing style remains evident, as they balance critique with admiration, particularly valuing well-written series featuring strong chemistry between lead characters.

Their interests align with narratives that provoke thought while providing entertainment, leaning towards content with witty dialogue and unexpected plot twists. The user demonstrates a positive outlook on shows that meld humor with serious themes, reinforcing their established affinity for sophisticated storytelling rich in depth and complexity.

The recent review highlights their continued engagement with iconic series, showcasing a fondness for stories that allow room for interpretation and personal reflection, which resonates with their desire for emotionally resonant content. This evolving preference underscores a consistent quest for narratives that are not only entertaining but also thought-provoking. Overall, the user favors series combining strong characters, clever writing, and the potential for both laughter and poignant moments, which contributes to their deeply satisfying entertainment experience.
